Description: Handle-plate of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with part of rim and handle; glaze fired red-brown; on top of rim, part of incised chain of lotuses and palmettes with added red; on handle-plate, sphinx seated to left, right paw raised; male eye and traces of red; top of head missing; on edge of plate, stepped zigzags fired brown to red; underside: top of handle attachment preserved, partly black; rest of underside reserved.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.106, no. A165)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 220, no. 58) ((where wrongly numbered 1886,0601.561))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.039) (Phase 1)
